description: Options to render charts in 3 dimensions. This feature requires highcharts-3d.js, found in the download package or online at code.highcharts.com/highcharts-3d.js.

children.name: alpha
children.description: One of the two rotation angles for the chart.

children.name: axisLabelPosition
children.description: Set it to "auto" to automatically move the labels to the best edge.

children.name: beta
children.description: One of the two rotation angles for the chart.

children.name: enabled
children.description: Wether to render the chart using the 3D functionality.

children.name: fitToPlot
children.description: Whether the 3d box should automatically adjust to the chart plot area.

children.name: frame
children.description: Provides the option to draw a frame around the charts by defining a bottom, front and back panel.

children.name: viewDistance
children.description: Defines the distance the viewer is standing in front of the chart, this setting is important to calculate the perspective effect in column and scatter charts. It is not used for 3D pie charts.
